TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in the village of GPE , GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants bought a house from the collective agricultural enterprise “ Svitanok ” . They lived in it with their CARDINAL minor children until DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE after returning from vacation the applicants found that their house was occupied by a police officer , PERSON latter informed them that the house purchase agreement had been invalidated by a notary . All of the applicants ' possessions had been moved to the “ Svitanok ” enterprise storehouse .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants instituted proceedings against the notary in ORG . On DATE the court cancelled the act by which the notary had invalidated the purchase agreement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted other proceedings in the same court against Mr S. , the “ Svitanok ” enterprise and the notary asking that Mr S. be evicted from their house and claiming CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( “ UAH ” ) in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . On an unidentified date the applicants introduced additional claims against the “ Svitanok ” enterprise for ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in pecuniary damage and ORG CARDINAL in non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the collective agricultural enterprise “ Svitanok ” initiated proceedings in the ORG challenging the validity of the house purchase agreement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court stayed the proceedings in the applicants ' case on eviction until the question of validity of the purchase agreement had been decided .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a wedding photo , a coat , a lamp , a wash - basin and some other small items which had been held at the “ Svitanok ” storehouse were returned to the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found the purchase agreement invalid . The applicants appealed against this judgment and requested the transfer of their case to another court . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the Head of ORG to transfer their case on eviction to another court . Their request was satisfied .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to consider together the case on eviction and the case on validity of the purchase agreement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court disjoined the cases and declined to consider the case on the validity of the purchase agreement because the representative of the ” Svitanok ” enterprise had failed twice to appear at a court hearing .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the house , which was partly derelict , was returned to the applicants .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicants introduced additional claims , requesting reimbursement of the costs of renovation of the house and payment of UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL and UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered a technical expert 's report on the applicants ' house . The expert stated that the court decision was received by him on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the expert carried out his survey . He concluded that it was not possible to live in the house and that it needed major renovation . The cost of such renovation was also determined .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found in part for the applicants and awarded each of the applicants ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in compensation for pecuniary damage , UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage and UAH CARDINAL in court expenses . The applicants did not appeal against this judgment .
CARDINAL . The applicants received some money and goods in enforcement of the judgment in their favour , but for the major part the judgment remains unenforced .
